fields.description:
h3.Summary

When looking to add a custom emoji via the instance's administration > *Emojis*, if the *Allow people to add custom emojis* toggle is off, although the user will be able to select the file, give it a name and tap the *Upload* button, a warning with an *upload failed* message will be displayed:

!failed_example.png|thumbnail!

From the browser's console, a "403" is triggered and also an error message:

{code}
Request URL: https://admin.atlassian.com/gateway/api/emoji/CLOUD-ID/site/token/upload
Request Method: GET
Status Code: 403 
Remote Address: XXXXXXXXX
Referrer Policy: strict-origin-when-cross-origin
{code}

{code}
Unable to upload emoji: No media api support is configured
{code}

h3.Suggestion

Since the error message is not clear, this is a suggestion to provide a message stating that the option to allow custom emojis is toggled off, needing to be toggled on.

This way, it quickly allows the administrators to understand what is the nature of the issue. Alternatively, not allowing the upload to happen until the option is toggled on would help as well.
fields.summary: Improve error handling when uploading emojis due to configuration

fields.description:
Currently, all users and groups of the source site will be migrated to the destination site.  There should be an option to choose just the users and groups that are relevant to projects being migrated.
 !2021-10-20_10-13-22-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Cloud-to-cloud migration - no option to choose users and groups specific to projects being migrated

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In case you end up upgrading one of your sandbox products' tier to, for example, Standard (from Free), the following email will be sent:
{code}
You can return to the Free plan at any time.

You can return to the Jira Service Management Free plan by limiting your account to 3 agents. If you don’t downgrade and have payment info on file when your trial ends on November 11, 2021, we’ll charge you based on your plan’s configuration.
{code}
 !Screen Shot 2021-10-14 at 09.59.42 (1).png|thumbnail! 

But that's not true. Currently, you cannot manage the billing on Sandboxes and it will not revert the license tier back even if you reduce the number of users/agents. There is an existing feature request about that behaviour as well: [Change the behaviour of sandboxes towards the licensing tier|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CLOUD-11339].

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Set up a production instance with Jira Software Premium and Jira Service ManAgement Free
* Create a sandbox with Jira Software Premium and Jira Service Management Free
* Add more agents to Jira Service Management so you have more than 3 agents, which is the limit in the Free tier
* That will then trigger a product upgrade on JSM

h3. Expected Results

An email will be sent stating that the product's tier was upgrade, but will not state that you can change it since that's not possible in sandboxes.

h3. Actual Results

An email is sent mentioning the product upgrade, and also stating that you can revert that scenario.

h3. Workaround

None at the moment.
fields.summary: Email states that you can downgrade a product tier on Sandboxes when you actually can't

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently sandboxes will start from the tier according to the licensing on the production instance.

For example: If you have Jira Software Premium and Jira Service Management Free, you will be able to have the same set up on a sandbox.

But, you can also end-up upgrading the tier of the Free product: 
* Still on the previous example, If you end up adding more agents to JSM and goes beyond the 3 agents limit for the Free tier your sandbox will have JSM upgraded to Standard automatically, which will then require payment
* If that happens, there is no easy way to revert back
** You cannot manage the billing of sandbox instances
** The license will not revert back even if you reduce the number of agents back to 3

At this time the only way to revert that scenario would be to delete the sandbox and start a new one from scratch.

h3. Suggestion

Provide a way to revert that scenario:
* Either provide the ability to manage the sandbox billing
* Or have the sandbox revert the licenses according to the license usage count
fields.summary: Change the behaviour of sandboxes towards the licensing tier

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If there are projects that use the Default Field Configuration in the source and destination sites - C2C migration assistant replaces and edits Default Field Configuration.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In source site, edit default field configuration to make an optional field *Required*, for example *Security Level*
 # Ensure test project is using *Default Field Configuration*
 # Ensure some projects in the destination site are using the *Default Field Configuration*
 # Ensure the *Default Field Configuration* in the destination site has the same *Security Level* field set to optional'
 # Migrate test project to destination

h3. Expected Results

Destination *Default Field Configuration* is not modified. Migration assistant could instead create a new field configuration and use that for migrated projects.

h3. Actual Results

Destination *Default Field Configuration* is modified and *Security Level* becomes a required field. This affects all destination projects and edits the configuration for any existing projects using that field configuration. This can break existing project functionality. 

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available


The target instance Default Field Layout Scheme also shows as modified:
{quote}
Default Field Layout Scheme
(Migrated on 13 Oct 2021 17:19 UTC)
{quote}
fields.summary: Cloud to Cloud migration assistant replaces and edits Default Field Configuration

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Jira Cloud to Cloud Migration tool only supports migrating Jira Software or Jira Core projects, not Jira Service Management projects (formerly Jira Service Desk)
h3. Suggested Solution

The Migration tool on the Cloud should support the migration of Jira Service Management projects as well
h3. Workaround

Please use [site export|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-cloud-administration/docs/export-issues/] and [site import|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/use-jira-site-import-to-migrate-from-server-to-cloud-972349848.html] feature in order to import Jira Service Desk projects to a cloud site.
fields.summary: Support Cloud to Cloud migration of Jira Service Management projects (formally Jira Service Desk)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

At this time, JSW C2C migration EAP doesn't support cross-organization project migration due to security reasons.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Migrating project from site A from Org A to Site B from Org B is not supported

h3. Expected Results

JSW C2C to support cross org migrations
h3. Actual Results

Currently not supported
h3. Workaround


Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Cross-organization project migration on JSW Cloud-to-Cloud EAP is not supported

fields.description:
By design, the C2C migration tool migrates all fields to the destination when migrating the content.

With this Next-gen fields are also migrated to the destination site whereas next gen projects are not supported for migration with the tooling.

Expected results:
The tool must differentiate and filter next-gen custom fields.
fields.summary: C2C migration Plugin Migrates Next Gen custom fields along with all custom fields.

fields.description: Recently, we have shipped the first version for the Jira Cloud to Cloud tooling, resources are available here [https://support.atlassian.com/migration/docs/cloud-to-cloud-migration/] unfortunately, this will migrate the Team Managed projects, it would be great the C2C migration tooling can also support Team Managed projects!
fields.summary: Team Managed projects support for Jira Cloud to Cloud tooling

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, when moving Jira projects from one cloud to another cloud site using the C2C plugin, team-managed (formerly next-gen) projects are not migrated. 
h3. Suggested Resolution

Allow C2C migration plugin to support team-managed (formerly next-gen) projects migration from one cloud to another cloud
fields.summary: C2C Migration plugin doesn't support team-managed (formerly next-gen) project Migration

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While doing export of project data in C2C flow, the export is failing as one of the changeItem within changeGroup has a blank String in it.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

TODO
h3. Expected Results

Export fails
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
 java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: MRI entity id must not be blank
	at com.atlassian.migration.base.mri.MRI.<init>(MRI.kt:32){noformat}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: ChangeGroup export failure due to blank 'newValues'

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Choose project page shows wrong number of issues present in a project
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Login to source jira site

 * Create an empty JSW classic project (Kanban or Scrum) for e.g. `Test Project 1`

 * Now login as System admin

 * Navigate to Migrate Cloud site

 * Start a new migration. Enter the migration name and choose a destination site and then navigate to Choose Projects page. Let's name the migration project `Test migration 1`

 * Select the newly created project i.e. `Test Project 1`

Oberservation:
 * Notice that "Issues" field show 0 issues

 * Click on Check for conflicts button to run the pre-flight checks

 * Click on Back to go to Choose Projects page again

 * Exit the migration flow and verify that the Migration, `Test migration 1`, has been saved.

 * Go the project that was created above i.e. `Test Project 1`

 * Create a test issue in the project for e.g. `Test Issue for migration`

 * Go back to the migrations dashboard page

 * Click on Review link for the migration plan created above i.e. `Test migration 1`

 * Click on Back to go to the Pre-flight check page

 * Click on Back again to go to the Choose Projects page

 * On this page the project `Test Project 1` should be selected already.

h3. Expected Results
 * It should have shown 1 issue present as we have created an issue. Although this issue was created after the migration plan was Saved still it should show the correct number of issues because now when we run the migration, it will migrate all of the issues present including the one that was created recently.

h3. Actual Results

Issues Field is still showing 0 issues present.
h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Choose project page shows wrong number of issues present in a project

fields.description:

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The rapidview entity has a deprecated field called owner. Currently, Jira export will panic if this field does not contain a valid account id.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Unknown
h3. Expected Results

Export proceeds successfully.
h3. Actual Results

Export fails with an IllegalArgumentException (i.e internal server error)
h3. Workaround

Manual manipulation of the board entities in the DB is a possible solution, but is rather difficult since rapidview is still managed by Active Objects.
fields.summary: Export fails when a board's owner is null or invalid

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

User needs to select *Continue with public access* again if they previously chose to continue and then navigated to the migration dashboard.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create migration plan
 # Enter plan name, destination site, choose projects and check for conflicts
 # Public access warning is detected
 # Select Continue with public access, confirm Continue
 # Select Review
 # All Checks show as complete (no warnings or errors)
 # Select Go to dashboard

h3. Expected Results
 # Migration plan in dashboard should show as Saved status with progress Ready to migrate

h3. Actual Results
 # Dashboard shows progress Some checks failed
 # Selecting Review takes you to Review page with warnings and errors
 # Viewing errors is the same public access warning

h3. Workaround

User needs to select *Continue with public access* again.
fields.summary: When "Project settings will allow public access" if user chooses to continue the progress will still show checks failed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a cloud-to-cloud migration is performed with translated locked custom fields, the migration fails if the destination has the same custom field as non-translated. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Migrate the translated custom fields (locked) to destination with the same custom field in non translated form.
 # Migration fails with error "Cannot find a locked custom field"

{code:java}
reason='Cannot find a locked custom field with name <non-english-language>{code}

h3. Expected Results

Migration should go through
h3. Actual Results

Migration fails with the below exception is thrown
{noformat}
reason='Cannot find a locked custom field with name <non-english-language>{noformat}
h3. Workaround

A potential workaround is to modify the locked custom field name to the one present on the source site, [contact-support|https://support.atlassian.com/contact/] for help
fields.summary: Cloud to Cloud migration fails while migrating translated custom fields

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

JSW managed issue types gets duplicated in C2C migration. There is no issue link in migrated epic and epic link for migrated story is blank.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a project with issues having epic issue links.
 # Migrate project

h3. Expected Results

1. Epic link for the migrated story should be set after migrated as expected and migrated epic should have issue link for story ticket.
h3. Actual Results

1. There is no issue link in migrated epic and epic link for migrated story is blank.
 2. Destination site has duplicate epic issue type with migrated suffix.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Some of issue types gets duplicated in C2C migration and epic issue links are not getting migrated

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

*java.util.NoSuchElementException: Collection contains no element matching the predicate.*
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a transition to your workflow where the source/destination step ID doesn't match any steps in the workflow.
 # Try migrating the project.

h3. Expected Results

Export should work fine.
h3. Actual Results

Export fails with this exception:
{noformat}
java.util.NoSuchElementException: Collection contains no element matching the predicate.
	at com.atlassian.migration.jira.classic.service.WorkflowService.toWorkflowTransition(WorkflowService.kt:497)
	at com.atlassian.migration.jira.classic.service.WorkflowService.toMigrationRequestBean(WorkflowService.kt:163)
	at com.atlassian.migration.jira.classic.service.WorkflowService.toMigrationRequestBean(WorkflowService.kt:50)
	at com.atlassian.migration.jira.executor.monolith.GenericMonolithMigrationService.toMigrationRequestBeans(GenericMonolithMigrationService.kt:75)
	at com.atlassian.migration.jira.classic.service.WorkflowService.migrateCore(WorkflowService.kt:109)
	at com.atlassian.migration.jira.classic.service.WorkflowService.migrate(WorkflowService.kt:104)
	at com.atlassian.migration.jira.classic.JiraClassicCoreExecutor.executeEntities(JiraClassicCoreExecutor.kt:75)
	at com.atlassian.migration.jira.executor.AbstractExecutor.execute(AbstractExecutor.kt:24)
	at com.atlassian.migration.jira.service.batch.BatchExecutor.execute(BatchExecutor.kt:26)
	at com.atlassian.migration.jira.service.orchestration.Orchestrator.dispatch(Orchestrator.kt:199)
{noformat}

Fix/remove the offending transition.
fields.summary: Workflow export fails due to invalid transition parameters

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a cloud to cloud migration is performed from a site with Connect apps installed to a site where the apps are not present, the import fails.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Migrate from a site with an app which is not present on destination site.
h3. Expected Results

Migration should work
h3. Actual Results

Migration fails with the below exception is thrown
{noformat}
ProjectRoleActor{id=''}] does not exist'{noformat}
h3. Workaround

A potential workaround is to install the apps on the destination site as well.
fields.summary: Cloud to Cloud migration fails while importing project role

This is not a UI issue. The response from API itself is coming like that. Maybe case-sensitive issue?

h3. Expected Results

1. Output should contain projects sorted by name in given order (ignoring the case)
h3. Actual Results

fields.description:
Hi there,

I am contacting you on behalf of IAGLoyalty. Recently we have created a status page using Atlassian's tool which is great! However, we realised that one feature which does not exist is modifying the uptime data shown on the component. The SLA shows 90 days and we were wondering if it would be possible to select the uptime data SLA to 30 days or 60 days for example? I understand that we could potentially use javascript to manipulate it but I can see the uptime data uses an SVG which might be difficult to manipulate.
fields.summary: Status page - feature request

fields.description: *HIPAA* (Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996) compliance for Jira and Confluence Cloud.
fields.summary: Connector Logging

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The customer is experiencing an unexpected behavior while refreshing their sandbox with production data, the custom fields are not being refreshed in the sandbox.

"when I viewed in Sandbox the custom fields, I found that there are still custom fields previously created in Sandbox that remained despite the refresh."

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Create a Sandbox
 * Create a custom field in the production instance and Move it to the trash
 * Copy data from production to sandbox
 * Then, the custom field that was moved to the trash on the production instance will appear as active on the sandbox instance.

h3. Expected Results
After the copy data from production, the sandbox should have the same data as the production instance, which means that if a custom field was moved to the trash in production it should appear as moved to the trash in the sandbox.

h3. Actual Results
The custom field that was moved to the trash on the production instance appears as active on the sandbox instance.

h3. Workaround
Permanently delete the trashed custom field in the production instance or even in the sandbox instance, if the copy from production was already done.
fields.summary: Trashed custom field in Production become Active in Sandbox after Data Copy from Production to Sandbox

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Show if an account is managed via Org under User Management

h3. Expected Results
When we access https://admin.atlassian.com/s/<CID>/users it could show a message when the account is managed via Org, for example: [evidence of an idea|https://share.getcloudapp.com/5zuNzWK1].

h3. Actual Results
When we access https://admin.atlassian.com/s/<CID>/users it won't show if the account is managed via Org.
fields.summary: Show if an account is managed via Org under User Management

fields.description:
h3. Problem
As of now there is no way a customer can stop the initiation once a copy of the prod data is initiated to sandbox. Even without attachments it can take close to a day or more than a day.

h3. Suggested Solution
If an estimation of the time is shown on the UI, then customer should be able to make a decision to continue or not by using a cancel button from the UI.

h3. Why This Is Important
 This gives the customers an opportunity to decide whether to go forward with the copy of production data based on hours it can take

h3. Workaround
_(Add a workaround, if available)_
fields.summary: We need a button to cancel from the UI to stop copying Production data to a sandbox once initiated

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When email addresses are added to the suppression list, it is needed to contact Atlassian support to provide the list and clear current occurrences. 
h3. Workaround

Atlassian support currently addresses those cases.
fields.summary: As an Org Admin I want to be able to export and clear the mail suppression list from my domain.

fields.description:
{panel:title=[July 15, 2021] Currently paused due to other change management priorities. Will revisit in H2 of FY22.}
We have currently prioritized other change management initiatives, which can be found here: [https://hello.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/CHG/pages/1011667682/Trusted+Change+Dashboard#ROADMAP-AND-DEMOS]. This work is dependent on the migrations team and will be revisited at the start of FY22.
{panel}
h6. *JOB STORY*

When I have marketplace apps installed and configured on my Jira & Confluence production instance

I want to be able to copy over the app data into my sandbox environment

So that the sandbox has a representative data set for me to do UAT testing
fields.summary: Ability to copy marketplace apps' data from production to sandbox

fields.description:
As a user I would like to monitor velocity over the trailing 12 Months

The current velocity report is limited to only 7 sprints

Please add a feature to select the date range or the sprint range to be included in the velocity report
fields.summary: Please expand velocity report beyond 7 sprints

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Copying Jira production data *with media files* to sandbox fails for customers with large instances

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
On a cloud site with large Jira data e.g 2TB of storage
 # Select the name of your organization at [admin.atlassian.com|http://admin.atlassian.com/] to access your organization *Administration* overview.
 # Go to *Products* > *Sandbox*.
 # Under *Actions* in the product table, select *Copy production data*.
# On the pop-up, choose *Copy data with media files*, then *Copy data*

h3. Expected Results
Data copy should be completed successfully after a few days, depending on the data size.

h3. Actual Results
Data copy fails after a few days & *no email notification* is sent to the customer.
h5. Internal error
{code:java}
Could not execute copy with token for zipper file with id: xxxx-xxxx-xxx-xxxx-xxxxx
{code}

h3. Workaround
Copy production data without media files
fields.summary: Copying production data *with media files* to sandbox fails for large cloud instances

fields.description:
Currently, Enterprise plan customers cannot see their total utilization against the site user limit for each site in their Enterprise plan. This makes it difficult for planning usage and flagging potential upgrades in advance.

Page currently looks like this

!Billing_–_Manage_subscriptions.png|width=1000!

Improved design would look like this:
!Billing_–_Manage_subscriptions2.png|width=1000!
fields.summary: Provide license utilization per product in Manage Subscriptions page of site billing console

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Customers are not able to push Insight Data to Sandbox. Due to that , all insight custom field data will be broken. On top of that, due to Insight workspace ID different in Sandbox , imported automation with Insight related configuration will be broken. ( separated bug : https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-10256).

h3. Suggested Solution
Ability to copy Insight data to Sandbox and remain the same workspace ID in Sandbox.

h3. Why this is important
Easy for admin to apply the same Insight data in Sandbox.

h3. Workaround 
* Take object type export from Production and import it to Insight Sandbox.
* Update again the Insight custom field configuration  ( Reselect the object schema) .
* Update again the automation configuration (Reselect the object schema)
fields.summary: Ability to copy Insight Data to Sandbox

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Personal Settings doesn't show the configuration of the impersonated user
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have 2 users; A (Site admin) and B (Basic user)
 # Grant Jira access for both of them 
 # Login with B and navigate to [https://URL.atlassian.net/secure/ViewPersonalSettings.jspa|https://url.atlassian.net/secure/ViewPersonalSettings.jspa]
 # Disable "Email notifications for issue activity" 
 # 
Login with A (make sure user A has their email enabled in Profile Settings) and impersonate user B
 # 
 Navigate to [https://URL.atlassian.net/secure/ViewPersonalSettings.jspa|https://url.atlassian.net/secure/ViewPersonalSettings.jspa]

h3. Expected Results

Email notifications for issue activity is disabled 
* !Screenshot 2021-09-16 at 17.10.53.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

Email notification for issue activity is enabled. This sends the wrong message to the user.
* !Screenshot 2021-09-16 at 17.11.16.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Personal Settings doesn't show the configuration of the impersonated user

fields.description:
Currently, even if the Site access permissions are set to *Don't approve any domains*, when you try to invite a new user to the site, there is the option to approve the domain being invited, changing the Site access settings.
|!Screen Shot 2021-09-13 at 08.35.06.png|width=172,height=155!|!Screen Recording 2021-09-10 at 11.57.50 AM.gif|width=293,height=368!|

It would be an improvement to have the option to +not+ have this checkbox, as it might not be desired to set any approved domains on an instance.
fields.summary: Remove the option to approve domain on the Invite users page

fields.description:
Cloud administrators frequently review or manage support requests created by users or admins within their organization. Currently, these support requests:
 # Are only visible on a separate property (support.atlassian.com) and there's no navigation between Support and Atlassian cloud administration.
 # Admins only have visibility into tickets they have been directly added to.

Ideally, we would automatically add certain org administrators to all tickets created by users within their organization, and have a place inside Admin Hub to actually view the tickets.
fields.summary: Show all Atlassian support requests related to an organization on admin.atlassian.com

fields.description: Testing
fields.summary: Testing

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

There is a known performance degradation for the customers using Windows with Google Chrome major version 92 and the CrowdStrike agent installed ([https://www.crowdstrike.com/]). We believe this is caused by a bug in the CrowdStrike agent which causes Chrome to have significantly reduced performance - resulting in reduced performance for some websites, including Jira Cloud. The observed regression varies between 3 and 8 seconds for page load times depending on the hardware and software being used. it is our understanding that Crowdstrike plans to release a fix sometime in September.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Load a Atlassian Cloud application (Jira or Confluence) and observe a noticeable performance degradation
 # Validate if user has the following in their environment:
 ## Google Chrome 92 (major version)
 ## Windows OS
 ## CrowdStrike agent

To identify if you have the CrowdStrike agent installed you can check if you have {{CrowdStrike Windows Sensor}} installed on your machine. Command-line can also be used to check if the agent is running with the command {{sc query CSFalconService}}
h3. Expected Results
 - Atlassian Cloud performance should not be impacted due to any Chrome browser update.

h3. Actual Results
 - We are experiencing longer loading times in Atlassian Cloud apps.

h3. Notes
 - This is also the bug on Chrome - [https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1238289]

h3. Workaround
 - Please use an alternate browser other than Chrome version 92. We recommend Firefox and Safari

 - Upgrade your Chrome browser from version 92 to version 93 (latest).
fields.summary: Performance issue for users with Windows, Chrome 92, and CrowdStrike agent

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It is only needed to pay for sandboxes if you have third-party apps installed on it and you want to keep using them after their trial period.

When that happens, an email notification will be sent describing the price that you would need to pay for the apps. But at this time the email notification might be misleading since it states that the product Jira/Confluence requires payment rather than the actual third-party apps:
 !2021-08-20 13_47_10-Atlassian (2).png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Create a Sandbox
* Add one or more third-party apps to it, and keep them installed until the end of their trial

h3. Expected Results

An email notification stating that you need to pay for those apps will be sent, and those apps will be listed on the email.

h3. Actual Results

The email notification states that the product Jira/Confluence will be renewed instead, giving the idea that you are paying for them.

h3. Workaround

None at the moment.
fields.summary: Misleading renewal email notification for Sandboxes

fields.description: When Trusted users or other admins invite users to a site, there is no way for the site admins to know about it except for viewing the list of users. This feature is necessary to properly manage the number of licenses and to avoid adding unnecessary users.
fields.summary: Ability to send notifications to site admins when a user is invited to a site.
Ability to see sandbox events in admin audit log

fields.description: Currently the [Get Users in Organization endpoint|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/organization/rest/api-group-orgs/#api-orgs-orgid-users-get] returns 50 users paginate and does not allow for custom page sizes. In order for developers to better dimension API calls and avoid rate limiting, it would be desirable that they could provide a parameter to the call and customize the amount of users that are returned.
fields.summary: Allow for custom pagination size in Get Users in Organization API

fields.description:
Currently, as mentioned here: [Manage product sandboxes|https://support.atlassian.com/organization-administration/docs/manage-product-sandboxes/], when creating a Sandbox environment and performing Copy Data to production, by default, the Global Mail Settings - Email puller on Sandbox is set to disabled. The only when to enable this is contacting support, as it is disabled by a system flag.

It would be nice for Org Admins to have the ability to enable or disable it on Sandbox side.

 

!image-2021-08-04-13-23-21-730.png!
fields.summary: Ability to enable Global Mail Settings - Email puller on Sandbox

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When migrating Atlassian account/user that already have existing Atlassian account, email is not sent, however there is still a pop up message with content saying [We'll email the <user> with details as to how to log into their Atlassian account]
h3. Suggested Solution
Use message that reflect the situation (where emails are not sent)
fields.summary: Misleading pop up message when migrating Atlassian account that already have existing Atlassian account

fields.description:
When inviting a user to my instance, this user could be disabled into another Organization that manages that account. 

The instance will just display a message that the account is disabled, which is confusing. 

h3. Suggestion
Add a better description and the next steps on how to proceed with that in cases like that.
fields.summary: As a site-admin, I'd like to see a better error message when inviting a disabled user

fields.description:
It would be nice to have a way for admins to disable this experiment for their specific site so none of users on that specific site would get messages like this anymore:
 !Screen Shot 2021-08-20 at 16.05.20.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Allow Administrators to turn off the Slack integration offer for managed users

fields.description: The functionality of the checkbox fields is not the same ever since switching to the new view. In order to see all the check boxes you have to click on the field and it shows them like a multiple pick drop down. Check boxes are supposed to be shown even if they are not checked, because the empty boxes prompt someone to take that action and check it off as complete. They can't do that if it's not visible. In the create screen, the check box field is displayed properly. Can you mimic that display with the new view screen?
fields.summary: Allow checkboxs to be displayed like they were in the old view. The new view has made the checkbox custom field type more like a drop down

fields.description:
It is not possible to change the domain name of the Cloud URL. Customer can only change the hostname part of the URL. 

This might be required if a company want to change the domain name from the old Cloud instance (jira.com) to (atlassian.net)

This feature will help customer wo whant to retain a similar domain name for their instances.
fields.summary: Allow changing the domain name of the Cloud URL

fields.description: To have a better control by customer, suggest to have Bring Your Own Key (BYOK) feature by Atlassian.
fields.summary: Bring Your Own Key (BYOK)

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently, according to the [Manage product sandboxes|https://support.atlassian.com/organization-administration/docs/manage-product-sandboxes/] documentation, add-ons we have installed on our prod sites are not mirrored to our sandbox environment, requiring us to subscribe to the add-ons and pay for them also for the sandbox site:
{quote}
h2. Add Marketplace and Atlassian apps to a sandbox

You can install apps from the Atlassian Marketplace or through the Manage apps screen from within your Jira or Confluence administration section of your sandbox. All apps are available on a free 30-day trial.

We’ll send you email notifications about your trial period ending. After the 30-day trial, you’ll need to add your payment details to purchase a subscription to keep using the app in your sandbox. Subscriptions for apps in your sandbox are available monthly, and the price for apps is calculated on the number of users with access to your sandbox, not your production environment. Currently, we don’t support annual subscriptions for apps in a sandbox.

All apps and app subscriptions are deleted when your sandbox is deleted.

For more details on apps, see Marketplace apps, Managing Confluence apps, and Managing Jira apps.
{quote}

h3. Suggestion
* Replicate the add-ons' subscriptions to sandbox sites without paying for an additional subscription on those add-ons.
fields.summary: Add-ons on Sandbox

fields.description:
Ops-Genie used to use about 5 phone numbers (that I've observed over the last 12-24 months) that were used for outbound alert notification.  Today I received a notification from "UNKNOWN CALLER" using a completely different area code.  I missed the alert, btw due to the unpublished change in behavior and unintuitive design.  My fault, ultimately.  However, your solution could be smarter.

With all of the SPAM calling present today, a single outbound caller ID is a "must have." The user can then easily add this to their SPAM whitelist or simply add an entry in their phone's contact list for easy ID.

This is not a cutting edge technical novelty.  This telecom capability has been around for many years.  So why not implement it?
fields.summary: Ops-Genie needs to have a single caller ID for outbound call notifications

fields.description: Admins would benefit from having a way to restore deleted groups through backups or a trash location before permanent deletion.
fields.summary: Add a group trash or the ability to restore deleted groups

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 21 May 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thank you all for your patience. The sandbox feature is now available to all Premium and Enterprise customers. This means that you will now have the ability to:
 # Create (an empty) sandbox
 # Delete a sandbox
 # Copy production data into your sandbox*

*There are some known caveats with what we do/do not copy. Please refer to our [official documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/manage-sandboxes-1019402392.html].

We expect that providing fully capable sandbox environments will be a multi-step journey. Please refer to the sub-tasks for the features we're working on and/or considering. We will continue to share updates on this ticket as soon as features are available. Don't hesitate to contact me directly if you have questions at [mtse@atlassian.com|mailto:mtse@atlassian.com].

Thanks,
 Matt Tse
 Senior Product Manager, Atlassian
{panel}
h2. What is a sandbox?

A sandbox is an isolated environment where admins & developers safely test applications and extensions and preview new features without impacting the production environment.

For more about sandboxes, please check out our [official documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/manage-sandboxes-1019402392.html].
fields.summary: Sandbox environment for Cloud (see sub-tasks for specific features)

fields.description:
h4. Problem Description

Although we have the [Ip Allowlisting|https://support.atlassian.com/security-and-access-policies/docs/specify-ip-addresses-for-product-access/], companies do not have a way to restrict their set of IPs to access *only instances that they select*. 

Customers want this to prevent a potential security breach. For example, if someone takes control of a user's computer since *api.media.atlassian.com* can't be blocked, they could upload protected files to a different Jira instance that they don't control, causing a leak.

h4. Suggested Solution

Have a feature to control *which Atlassian sites the users inside X range of IPs can access*.
fields.summary: Select which product URLs (instances) a range of IPs are allowed to access.

fields.description:
Suggestion : Provide a self service report which will allow organization administrators to see the enterprise license usage. 

Workaround : Please contact Atlassian support to know the current license usage.
fields.summary: Provide a report for the enterprise license usage

fields.description:
Hello,

It's super difficult when working with Automation for Jira's WebHooks whilst leveraging saved variables from previous states as you cannot validate that Webhook without running the entire automation rule and in doing so you're then unable to see the payload that was sent, purely the error message.
fields.summary: Save Automation for Jira Webhook Data

fields.description:
# As a Jira Atlassian user I get already today an epic report on the base of story points. Additionally, I would like to get a report the same way on the base of logged time.

2. As a Jira Atlassian user I would like to have the logged time automatically synchronized to SAP Fiori
fields.summary: Reports for time logged and interface to SAP Fiori

fields.description: It would be nice to be able to perform copies of data production into the sandbox on a scheduled basis for the purpose of ensuring the most up-to-date data when using the Sandbox feature for testing changes before introducing them into production.
fields.summary: Allow scheduled basis copies of Data Production into Sandbox

fields.description:
as a user, I would like to be able to pull Billing information and basic usage, like the last login via API.

 

Right now is not possible
fields.summary: ability to pull Billing info and basic usage via API

fields.description:
h3. Suggestion

Incoming email is not allowed in the Sandbox instance. Even, the default mail handler won't work. This should be explicitly specified in the public documentation - https://support.atlassian.com/organization-administration/docs/manage-product-sandboxes/.
fields.summary: Sandbox document should specify that incoming email is not allowed

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, Cloud has the option to do IP whitelist but that would require users to be connect to a VPN.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow whitelisting by Mac addresses or by issuing a client side SSL certificate for all internal users laptops.
fields.summary: Allow users to control the devices with access to the site

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Sandbox creator has different set of billing options in left menu bar from admin page in comparison to newly created site-admins in the sandbox.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a sandbox
 # Invite a user
 # Set the new user as site-admin
 # Compare left menu views from the admin page and notice that the billing options differ

h3. Expected Results
Menu options should be the same

h3. Actual Results
Menu options are different

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Sandbox creator has different set of billing options in left menu bar from admin page

fields.description:
At this moment, we’ll email all organization admins of the product's site every two weeks with the future product changes and the date you’ll start to receive them if their product is on the bundled release track. 

It would be nice if org admins have control to set their preferences and could turn off these emails if they want.
fields.summary: Ability to remove an Org Administrator from the Bundled Release email list

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to retrieve the details of the nextgen project using the call defined here --> [Project key or ID API|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-projects/#api-rest-api-3-project-projectidorkey-get]

The inPrivate field returns false even though the project access set to Private. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * In the rest client, provide the URI https://your-domain.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/project/\{projectIdOrKey} for GET method. Ensure that the projectID or key is team managed project and access is private.
 * You will see that the value returned is false.

h3. Expected Results

The inprivate option returns true when the project is Private
h3. Actual Results

The inprivate options returns false
h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: API call for team managed project access does not return right results

fields.description:
I do not see any project for status page (even though it directed me here).  The templates on the status page for incidents and maintenance windows are extremely simple.  It would be really great if variables or selectors, etc could be incorporated into it.

 

For example if I have a planned maint window, with a 4 hour downtime, it would be awesome if i could set a variable in the template to startdate starttime, and have the enddate endtime (being calculated off the downtime amount), so that when an email goes out it fills in those fields.

Thanks,

Mike
fields.summary: statuspage template suggestion

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It is possible to delete a product subscription trough the *Manage subscriptions* section on your site's administration:
 !Screen Shot 2021-06-18 at 10.42.52.png|thumbnail! 

There is a confirmation step, which requires you to type in *DELETE* to confirm the operation. But the confirmation is asked only for the user performing the action.

h3. Suggestion

Given that such action might cause the deletion of production data, it implement an additional confirmation step that requires approval from other admins given the severity of such operation.
fields.summary: Implement an additional confirmation step for product deletion

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When an impersonated request returns 403, we classify this as forbidden general vs token error.
Only the latter should block user from being impersonated. 
Both cases should still retry as the A4J user.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
fire a rule who was Actor set to "user who triggered the evet"

h3. Expected Results
Automation should impersonate users

h3. Actual Results

Automation for Jira is being blocked to impersonate user

h3. Workaround

No workaround provided
fields.summary: Users are incorrectly being blocked from impersonation

fields.description:
Connect based apps already have a by-pass for IP allow-list per JWT authentication method, but for certain app features where the use of the api.atlassian.com infrastructure is necessary, requests will be blocked.

In some cases, the IP ranges from the add-on vendor may exceed the limits of the Atlassian IP allow-list policy.

h2. Suggestion
Implement support for the JWT authentication method for by-passing IP allow-list.
fields.summary: Enable by-pass of IP Allow-lists for Connect apps using api.atlassian.com

fields.description:
Currently, when the *Copy Data to Sandbox* process fails, the customer receives an email mentioning that the process *completely* failed, however, there isn't any details available of it.

It would be nice to have those details, as small failures (e. g. copy of only a few spaces in Confluence) can be manually solved by exporting/importing the failed spaces instead of copying the entire instance again to Sandbox.
fields.summary: Improved visibility of errors/logging when attempting to Copy Data to Sandbox.

fields.description:
Currently in JWM there is no option to hide or remove all issue that are already completed or done.

 

This piles up issue under the done column.
fields.summary: Allow issue under done column to be hidden or removed

fields.description:
h3.Summary

By default, when [creating a sandbox|https://support.atlassian.com/organization-administration/docs/manage-product-sandboxes/], it is possible to import the data from production.

As sandboxes are generally used to test data prior to pushing it to production, it would be helpful if an option to keep the sandbox in sync with the production existed so any changes applied to the sandbox could be delivered to production (and vice-versa) with a single button once they are evaluated.

h3.Suggestion

This is a suggestion to have a sync option to allow users to keep the sandbox environment in sync with production without necessarily starting a new copy from the scratch
fields.summary: Ability to keep sandbox synced with production data

fields.description: teste
fields.summary: teste

fields.description:
# Use the latest 2.1 version of CircleCI pipeline process engine. See: https://circleci.com/docs/2.0/configuration-reference
version: 2.1
# Use a package of configuration called an orb.
orbs:
  # Declare a dependency on the welcome-orb
  welcome: circleci/welcome-orb@0.4.1
# Orchestrate or schedule a set of jobs
workflows:
  # Name the workflow "welcome"
  welcome:
    # Run the welcome/run job in its own container
    jobs:
      - welcome/run
fields.summary: Config.yml

fields.description:
# Use the latest 2.1 version of CircleCI pipeline process engine. See: https://circleci.com/docs/2.0/configuration-reference
version: 2.1
# Use a package of configuration called an orb.
orbs:
  # Declare a dependency on the welcome-orb
  welcome: circleci/welcome-orb@0.4.1
# Orchestrate or schedule a set of jobs
workflows:
  # Name the workflow "welcome"
  welcome:
    # Run the welcome/run job in its own container
    jobs:
      - welcome/run
fields.summary: Config.yml

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Sandboxes are not shown under the SANDBOX section in the organization when products are transferred in between organizations

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Sandbox in OrgA
 # Transfer products to OrgB
 # The transferred Sandbox will only be available under the Overview of products. Not under Sandbox. Hence the functionality to move production data and delete is not available.

h3. Expected Results
Sandboxes should be under the SANDBOX section in the organization when products are transferred in between organizations

h3. Actual Results
Sandboxes are not shown under the SANDBOX section in the organization when products are transferred in between organizations

h3. Workaround
Contact Atlassian support
fields.summary: Sandboxes are not shown when products are transferred in between organizations

fields.description: as a user, we would like to have the ability to bulk change project's board, create boards and copy boards
fields.summary: bulk changes boards

fields.description:
Dada la decisión de Atlassian de descontinuar la versión server de Jira / Confluence y Bitbucket, surge la necesidad para muchas organizaciones de migrar a la plataforma de Atlassian Cloud.

El mayor desafío que nos encontramos en mi organización está relacionado con los requisitos de seguridad exigidos para plantearnos dicha migración.

Es por ello que me gustaría preguntar si están valorando cumplir con el Esquema Nacional de Seguridad de la Administración Electrónica Española. 

Cualquier información al respecto sería de gran utilidad para ayudarnos a dar los siguientes pasos.
fields.summary: Cumplimiento del ENS (Esquema Nacional de Seguridad)

fields.description: Can you please show the account's Create Date when we enter the account details (or even on the list) either on User management and Managed accounts? It would help a lot. Thank you.
fields.summary: Show the create date on the user account details

fields.description:
The site admin can control how users get access to the site, and users with approved domains can join the site without invitation. There is a risk of mistakenly self-joining a site that should not be used and putting sensitive information on it.
Before setting a domain to "Approved domain", I think the system needs to check if the domain is claimed by another organization. If so, an alert should be displayed to prevent the domain from being set up, or it should be approved by the organization that owns the domain. Alternatively, the organization should be able to remove their domain from that setting.
fields.summary: Suggestions for domains that can be set to "Approved domain"

fields.description:
I would like to both:
 # silence the notification when my shift starts
 # _not_ silence any other notifications

The reason: my shift starts at 6am. I'm asleep and would like to stay asleep. However, if there is a P1 incident I would like to wake up.

 

Meta feedback: it was challenging to work out how to submit this feedback. From opsgenie dashboard -> contact support -> product suggestions -> "Go to product suggestions" -> Jira system dashboard page -> Create -> guess which project (Opsgenie not an option) -> write description -> discover that "Component" is mandatory -> see that none of the components are "opsgenie" -> give up and pick "Infrastructure" and submit anyway
fields.summary: Silence Opsgenie Shift Start Notification

fields.description:
* An option to disable certain products in the app switcher. Specifically to hide products as the admin requires. 
* This would help admins in a way that users do not navigate to specific products that they do not require. 

 !image-2021-05-19-16-51-38-224.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Allow Specific Product Disabling in App Switcher

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you have a Confluence Premium subscription, you are able to create a Sandbox, and copy the data from production to it. However, the copy feature is not working properly on some Instances due to permission errors.

(on) This bug doesn't affect all Instances. We are currently investigating it so we can narrow down the root cause of it.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Sandbox for Confluence Cloud.
 # Trigger the data copy.

h3. Expected Results

The data copy should work as expected.
h3. Actual Results

The process failed.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Data Copy from Production to Sandbox is not working properly for Confluence

fields.description:
When we try to search for the Jira issue through confluence advance search, it doesn't give correct results.
Suppose if i am trying to search for my project id like ABC-123 , the search is not giving correct results.
I tried using the correct search syntax for confluence like "ABC-123" but no success.

Use case: I am trying to search for all the confluence pages where this jira link is mentioned.
fields.summary: improve the search ability for Jira issues in confluence

fields.description:
*Problem Statement*

When adding a list of users email and the list contains existing users, the following vague error popups:
 "We couldn't send your invitations. Try inviting those users again."

*Steps to replicate* 
 # Go to Site-admin > Users > Add Users
 # Insert multiple emails which contains an existing users
 # Click invite X users 

*Result*

**The following error popsup:

"We couldn't send your invitations. Try inviting those users again."

*Suggestion*
 Popup an Error with a specific message that contains the exact problem. This will be an issue if the list are too long and without knowing what causes the error.
fields.summary: Vague error popup when adding existing users from the site-admin

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The word "don't" is missing the apostrophe, and appears as "dont"
h3. Steps to Reproduce

If I go to Settings (gear icon -> Issues -> Workflows, and then click "View" next to "Software Simplified Workflow
h3. Expected Results

the word "don't" instead of "dont"
h3. Actual Results

  !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The word "don't" is missing the apostrophe, and appears as "dont"

fields.description:
The Link to download Jira Cloud backups is currently restricted to only the users who generated that backup.

This behavior is not consistent with Confluence where a Confluence Cloud backup is accessible to any admin users, not just those who generated the backup.

*Suggestion:*

If a Cloud backup exists Make Jira Cloud Backups available to all Jira Admin's and not just the user generating the backup.
fields.summary: Make Jira Cloud Backup download link available to all Jira Admins

fields.description:
*Actual Results:*

 Scenario 1:
 Eg: 
 1) *The Issue without any comments on the ticket and the User with "Browse Project" and "Add Comments" Permission will see:*
 !image-2021-04-30-14-24-19-888.png|thumbnail! 
 2) *The issue with more than zero comments on the ticket and User with "Browse Project" and "Add Comments" Permission will see:*
 !image-2021-04-30-14-23-40-732.png|thumbnail!

Scenario 2:
 Eg: 
 1) *The Issue without any comments on the ticket and the User with only the "Browse Project" Permission will see:*
 !image-2021-04-30-14-25-53-822.png|thumbnail! 
 2) *The Issue with more than Zero comments on the ticket and the User with only the "Browse Project" Permission will see:*
 !image-2021-04-30-14-27-54-092.png|thumbnail!

*Expected/Suggested Results:*

The customer suggests that the Comments Lozenge/Tab should be visible by design, even when comments are zero and the user only has "Browse Project" Permission(As mentioned in Scenario 2 --> Eg 1). It would be better to show this Comment Lozenge with a message below that says "No Comments Yet" as it informs the users that the reason they can't see comments is that there are none. Otherwise, they assume that:
 * They don't have access to the comments and raise support tickets, or…
 * The comments are hidden from them on purpose.
fields.summary: Comments Lozenge on the New Issue View hidden when there are "No comments Added" and "Add Comments" Project Permission is not granted to the User.

fields.description: Audit Log show "delete issues" and who deleted it
fields.summary: Audit Log show "delete issues" and who deleted it

fields.description:
Admins would benefit for a better user export interface and additional options to filter what users to export to a CSV file, for example, filtering only the active users that have access to a specific product directly in the user management page and having the option to export only the already filtered users.

Currently the user export dialog disregards whatever filter is already applied in the user admin interface and the access groups have to be manually populated in the export interface.
fields.summary: Better filtering and user export options for billing control

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Subscribing to [Atlassian Team Central|https://www.atlassian.com/software/team-central] render the Overview page of your Organization to not load properly the Plan and User Count for each product you have.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Subscribe to Team Central here: [https://www.atlassian.com/software/team-central]
 # Go to [https://admin.atlassian.com/], locate the Atlassian Organization you added Team Central to and drilldown.

h3. Expected Results
Page [https://admin.atlassian.com/o/OrgId/overview] should load without any errors and Plan and User count is displayed correctly.

h3. Actual Results
The page [https://admin.atlassian.com/o/OrgId/overview] displays the error _Something went wrong_ and the Plan and User count column for your products are displayed as blank.

Capturing the XHR requests in the background you will see a request like this:

{code}POST https://bam.nr-data.net/jserrors/1/a9007e5cee{code}

Parameter _err_ contains
{code}[{"params":{"stackHash":-548131357,"exceptionClass":"Error","request_uri":"/o/<orgID>/overview","message":"product with the given type \"TEAMCENTRAL\" was not found for cloudId <orgID>","stack_trace":"Error: product with the given type \"TEAMCENTRAL\" was not found for cloudId <orgID>\n    at Jr.<anonymous> (https://admin.atlassian.com/app.84f0f090aa12ec514395-9.js:367:216073)\n    at Generator.next (<anonymous>)\n    at o (https://admin.atlassian.com/app.84f0f090aa12ec514395-9.js:367:214146)","releaseIds":"{}","pageview":1},"metrics":{"count":1,"time":{"t":3577}}},{"params":{"stackHash":-548131357,"exceptionClass":"Error","request_uri":"/o/<orgID>/overview","message":"product with the given type \"TEAMCENTRAL\" was not found for cloudId <cloudId>","browser_stack_hash":619413400,"releaseIds":"{}","browserInteractionId":"<browserInteractionId>"},"metrics":{"count":1,"time":{"t":35891}}}]{code}

h3. Workaround
Go to Billing page in the Atlassian Organization admin page to see your plan and user count for each product your Organization has.
fields.summary: Subscribing to Team Central causes the admin overview page to not load properly plan and user count

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
* A user who no longer has access to a site, might have their "Last seen" value updated, implying that the user has had access to the site.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Get a user to set up the Jira iOS app
** https://apps.apple.com/us/app/jira-cloud-by-atlassian/id1006972087
# Remove the user Site and Product Access of the user.
** Do not remove the user account, just the Site and Product Access.
# The user will no longer be able to log into the site any longer from any browsers.
# They won't be able to access the site from the Jira iOS app, but the action of opening the app will update their last seen on the site.
**  !last_seen.PNG|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Expected Results
* User's "Last Seen" should not be updated when they do not have access to the site.

h3. Actual Results
* User's "Last Seen" is updated even when they do not have access to the site.

h3. Workaround
* There are no workarounds for the issue for now.
fields.summary: User with no site access might appear as active by "Last seen" value if they use the Jira iOS app

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira Service Management custom email handlers are copied over to sandbox sites.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On the production site, create a Jira Service Management project
# Go to the Project settings > Email requests
# Configure a custom email address as a [mail channel|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicemanagementserver/receiving-requests-by-email-939926303.html]
# Go to the admin panel and [copy your production site data to a sandbox|https://support.atlassian.com/organization-administration/docs/manage-product-sandboxes/]
# Check the same Jira Service Management project on the sandbox site.

h3. Expected Results

There won't be any custom email channel.

h3. Actual Results

The email channel will be copied over and will start pulling messages from the mailbox, which may cause the production instance to miss some emails.

h3. Workaround

Delete the email channel from the sandbox instance.
fields.summary: Jira Service Management custom email handlers are copied over to sandbox sites.

fields.description: If a user belongs to more than 5 groups, you have to page down to see all the groups.  This is a very poor choice for usability.  It's especially bad when you consider that the Groups area occupies < 4% of the total screen real estate, while the whitespace occupies over 65%. It's a shame I can't upload a screenshot.
fields.summary: User details page has too much whitespace, not enough information

fields.description:
Currently, we can only set the landing page for all users.
It would be nice to have the ability to set it on a user level or even group level at least.
fields.summary: Ability to set landing page per user or group

fields.description:
It seems some particularly enterprising individuals have realized they can take advantage of public Jira issues to force spam on the thousands of people following the issue.

For example, see the April 1 comments on CLOUD-6999.

These targeted sales messages were forced on each of the thousands of people watching this issue. There should be a way to report these comments as spam.
fields.summary: Allow reporting spam in public Jira comments

fields.description: Due to the great number of groups, Jira projects and Confluence spaces it is very difficult to manage group changes and accesses, so it would be very helpful if we could know where a group is being used, in what project, in what space, in what rule, restriction, validation etc.
fields.summary: Know where groups are used

fields.description:
h3. Summary
IP [whitelisting|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/ip-allowlisting-998658750.html] access is applied on a product's base, and it's not possible to restrict access according to specific project/space.

h3. Use case
It would be nice to have the option to whitelist only specific projects in Jira / spaces in Confluence.
fields.summary: Allow setting IP allowlisting feature by specific projects/spaces

fields.description: Similar to how OpsGenie works, create a way to set up alerts based on a threshold of license usage set by the administrator.
fields.summary: As a billing contact, I would like to set thresholds for licensing alerts

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When an add-on is deleted from the Market place , "Manage subscription" page under admin.atlassian.com will not load. Instead it throws a generic error message that "We cant load this page right now".
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add-on is deleted from marketplace by the vendor, which in this case is ZAPI cloud which is deleted from Marketplace at the time of this ticket creation.
 # Access the "Manage subscription" page.

h3. Expected Results

Page should load with other subscription details, possibly with a warning that ZAPI ( add-on in question) is deleted by vendor.
h3. Actual Results

Manage subscription page loads with generic error message.

The below exception is thrown in network tab
{noformat}
Request - {cloud_id}/bill-estimate
Response - 500 Error. {"message":"Request failed with status code 400"}

{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround from the UI, as we cannot un-subscribe the add-on from the "Manage Apps" section. ( Please refer screen shot). 
 Please do reach out to [https://support.atlassian.com|https://support.atlassian.com/] with this Bug details to get it un-subscribed from the back end.
fields.summary: "Manage subscriptions" page does not load from admin.atlassian.com if an add-on is deleted from Marketplace.
